senses.de: In a detailed and thorough way
senses.ex: I will study the history of World War II in depth.

Tips.title: Research Context
Tips.description: Use 'in depth' when describing extensive research or exploration of a topic.
Tips.example: She is going in depth into renewable energy studies.

Tips.title: Not Surface Level
Tips.description: Implies going beyond superficial details to understand something complex.
Tips.example: The documentary covers the issue in depth, not just the headlines.

Tips.title: Time Investment
Tips.description: Suggests dedicating a significant amount of time to thoroughly investigate something.
Tips.example: I'll need to examine these findings in depth before deciding.

senses.de: Having detailed knowledge or understanding about a particular subject
senses.ex: He has an in-depth understanding of the situation.

Tips.title: Knowledge Level
Tips.description: Indicates a profound level of knowledge or comprehension of a subject.
Tips.example: His in-depth knowledge of history won him the quiz.

Tips.title: Detailed Explanation
Tips.description: Use when you can explain something with a lot of details and specifics.
Tips.example: She provided an in-depth explanation of the theory.

Tips.title: Beyond Basics
Tips.description: Means that the understanding goes beyond basic concepts to the finer points.
Tips.example: His in-depth analysis went beyond the basics.
